titleStmt.title: The Inventory of St Leodegar in Schönenwerd (1622), ed. Claudio Bacciagaluppi (Historical Music Inventories, 7)

publicationStmt.publisher: Swiss RISM Office, Université de Fribourg, Switzerland

msIdentifier.idno: Stift St. Leodegar zu Schönenwerd, Protokolle, vol. 1 (1607–37)

msContents.summary: Melchior Roth, canon of the collegiate church of St Leodegar in Schönenwerd (in today’s canton Aargau, Switzerland), bequeathed his musical books to the church chapter in 1622. The chapter minutes contain, in October 1622, a list of the approximately thirty items from his donation. The inventory, then, does not reflect the collegiate’s collection, but rather the private musical interests of canon Roth. It is worth noticing that Roth may even have been only an amateur. He in fact was neither the ‘cantor’ (Erhard Gerrn, since 1607) nor the organist (Johann Jost Hutter until 1621, and Johannes Gryfesanus 1621–24). The names of these musical charges in the collegiate church are reported at other places in the same volume of chapter minutes (pp. 1, 37a, 52a and 123a). Roth’s collection is fairly eclectical, covering mostly contemporary sacred music from German-speaking countries (Eichinger, Erbach) but also ‘international’ repertoire (Victoria) and even secular music (Gastoldi).
